content.description:
This is a steep bolted arete at the top of Saddle Rocks. The rock is mostly good compared to the routes down the hill from this one.

The bolts are in the right place to protect all the difficult moves but there is a significant runnout from the last bolt to the summit- very exciting! Not recommended if you are just breaking into 5.9 slab routes though- possibly a little more difficult than 5.9.
content.protection:
7 bolts. The last bolt is a rusty flexing 1/4" button head. Run it out from this bolt to the top of the formation. I set a natural anchor using slings on horns.

From the right side of the formation you can down climb a wide crack to an anchor and rap down to the gully with a 60m rope.

climbs.name: More Hustle Than Muscle
climbs.fa: Hank Levine and Dag Kolsrud, December 1978

content.description: A crux undercling leads up and left to a hand crack.  Follow the hand crack to the top.
content.protection:
Gear to 3 inches, can use bolted anchor for

Check Your Head
content.location: This is up and right from Boom Boom Room.

climbs.name: Check Your Head
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Pete Paredes, March 1996

content.description: Despite appearances this loose and grainy face is not worth your time, but who knows it might clean up some day with enough traffic.
content.protection:
TR from bolted anchor on ledge shared with

More Hustle Than Muscle
content.location:
The face between

Boom Boom Room

and

More Hustle Than Muscle

.

climbs.name: Boom Boom Room
climbs.fa: Randy Vogel, Dianne Brown, and Charles Cole, December 1977

content.description: Climb past five bolts on the steep face.  Traverse right from the first bolt (exciting).  The crux is probably getting past the third bolt; go left, down, and then back up to easier going.  A scary swinging fall would be possible for the second; this can be avoided by pulling the rope through the biners from the top and then tossing it back down.
content.location: This climb starts a bit right of center on the south face.
